title: Implement basic authentication to replace hardcoded password
description: Replace hardcoded password with proper authentication. Implement session-based or JWT auth, secure password storage, and protect API endpoints. Keep it simple for single couple use.

title: Deploy backend to Railway and configure environment
description: Set up Railway project, configure environment variables, set up PostgreSQL database, deploy backend API, and verify deployment. Configure CORS for frontend access.

title: Set up backend infrastructure with Node.js/Express for Railway deployment
description: Initialize a Node.js backend with Express framework that can be deployed to Railway's free tier. Include basic server setup, package.json configuration, and deployment config.

title: Design database schema for favor tracking system
description: Design database schema to store users, favor transactions, and balances. Choose appropriate database (PostgreSQL/SQLite) for Railway deployment. Include tables for users, favors history, and settings.

title: Refactor frontend: split into reusable components
description: Break down the monolithic favor-tracker.jsx into smaller components: BalanceDisplay, FavorButtons, HistoryList, PasswordModal, etc. Improve code maintainability and reusability.

title: Migrate from localStorage to backend API for data persistence
description: Update React frontend to use backend API instead of localStorage. Implement API client with fetch/axios, add loading states, error handling, and maintain backward compatibility during migration.

title: Implement REST API endpoints for favor operations
description: Create API endpoints: GET/POST /favors (list & create favors), GET /balance (current balance), POST /settle (settle up), GET /history (favor history with pagination). Include request validation and error handling.
